course_description: This course will function as an historical survey of the visual images that exemplify the philosophical and aesthetic concepts that shaped Western culture from the Paleolithic Period through the fourteenth fourteenth century. The aesthetic, historical and technical aspects of major art forms, including painting, architecture, drawing, and sculpture, will be studied in relation to the socioeconomic and political developments in Western civilization.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3230, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: A. Maloney, Status: Closed
